alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 04 at 5:05PM CDT until October 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Choctaw and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts from 1 to 3 inches are expected this evening and into early Thursday morning, with localized totals to 5 inches possible. These amounts could lead to flash flooding despite persistent dry conditions, especially if they fall over a short amount of time. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
